name: GDD Adwords
author: Emiliani

sections.description:
GDD Adwords add links on predefined words, based on user options, in all WordPress posts.
It does not affect the original post content.

Arbitrary section

…

A brief Markdown Example

Ordered list:

  1. …

Unordered list:

  • …

Here’s a link to WordPress and one to Markdown’s Syntax Documentation.
Titles are optional, naturally.

Markdown uses email style notation for blockquotes and I’ve been told:

Asterisks for emphasis. Double it up for strong.

<?php code(); // goes in backticks ?>
sections.installation:
1. Download the plugin here: https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/gdd-adwords-wordpress-plugin/ or search in wp-admin/plugins for “gdd-adwords”
  2. Install thourgh WordPress admin panel.
  3. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  4. Go to options, select ‘GDD Adwords’ and submit your keyword list, link address and other URL specific statements.
sections.faq:
It does affect the original post content?

It does not affect the original post content.

It does change the existing html in a post?

No.
sections.changelog:
1.0

  • Fixed the KEYWORD IN HTML TAG bug.

1.1

  • Fixed a bug and improved the search&replace routine in patterns
